properties.Name: CashBudget
properties.Description:
The cash budget is used for cash planning and control

It is the expected cash inflow/outflow for a period and helps management keep cash balances at an appropriate level for cash needs.     

This help avoid having unused cash available as well as cash shortages.

The cash budget normally consists of 4 sections:

1.  Receipts Section = beginning cash balance, cash collections from customers and other receipts

2.  Disbursements Section = All cash payments 

3.  Cash Surplus/Deficit Section = The difference between the cash receipts section and the cash disbursements section

4.  Financing Section = A detailed account of the borrowings and repayments expected during the period.

Columns.Name: CashBudgetId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Cash Budget.

Columns.Name: CashBudgetVersionId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Cash Budget Version.

Columns.Name: BeginningCashBalanceAmount
Columns.Description: The amount of cash at the beginning of the period.

Columns.Name: EndingCashBalanceAmount
Columns.Description: The amount of cash at the end of the period.

Columns.Name: PlannedReceiptsFromCustomersAmount
Columns.Description: The planned total of receipts to be collected from customers as of the indicated date.

Columns.Name: ActualReceiptsFromCustomersAmount
Columns.Description: The actual total receipts collected from customers as of the indicated date.

Columns.Name: PlannedTotalDisbursementsAmount
Columns.Description: The planned total cash disbursements as of the indicated date.

Columns.Name: ActualTotalDisbursementsAmount
Columns.Description: The actual total cash disbursements as of the indicated date.

Columns.Name: PlannedTotalCashAvailableAmount
Columns.Description: The planned total cash to be available as of the indicated date.

Columns.Name: ActualTotalCashAvailableAmount
Columns.Description: The actual total cash available as of the indicated date.

Columns.Name: PlannedTotalFinancingAmount
Columns.Description: The planned total financing disbursements amount as of the indicated date.

Columns.Name: ActualTotalFinancingAmount
Columns.Description: The actual total financing disbursements amount as of the indicated date.

Columns.Name: FinancialBudgetId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Financial Budget.

Columns.Name: FinancialBudgetVersionId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Financial Budget Version.

Properties.Description:
The cash budget is used for cash planning and control

It is the expected cash inflow/outflow for a period and helps management keep cash balances at an appropriate level for cash needs.     

This help avoid having unused cash available as well as cash shortages.

The cash budget normally consists of 4 sections:

1.  Receipts Section = beginning cash balance, cash collections from customers and other receipts

2.  Disbursements Section = All cash payments 

3.  Cash Surplus/Deficit Section = The difference between the cash receipts section and the cash disbursements section

4.  Financing Section = A detailed account of the borrowings and repayments expected during the period.
